page.title: 03BIOGRAPHY:SWANSEA WEST
page.content: Derrick Morris,one of Britain's first heart transplant patients, was born on March 24 1930 in Brynmill,Swansea.His jobs included outfitter,insurance agent and,later, dock worker. He had a heart attack in 1975 and had the heart transplant operation in February 1980 at Harefield Hospital in Middlesex. The operation took 4\ hours and his expected chance of recovery was only 15%. He remained in hospital for six months afterwards. He was 11st.8lbs. before the operation and now he is 11st. He is an active sportsman, enjoying cycling,walking and running. He has regularly taken part in fund raising activities,especially for the British Heart Foundation. He has become a celebrity in Swansea and in Britain as a whole. He hopes his efforts will lead to a healthier,fitter society.
